meanings.definition: Avoids or neglects a duty or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: He always shirks his chores by pretending to be busy.
meanings.sent2: She shirks her homework by watching TV instead.
meanings.sent3: The cat shirks its duty to catch mice and just naps all day.
meanings.sent4: The student shirks responsibility like a shadow in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The employee who shirks work is like a boat without a sail, going nowhere.

meanings.definition: A person who avoids work or duty.
meanings.sent1: The shirks in the office always leave early.
meanings.sent2: She is known as the office shirks for avoiding tasks.
meanings.sent3: The lazy shirks at the park sit around all day.
meanings.sent4: He is a shirks, always finding ways to avoid responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: The shirks in the group project never contribute, like a broken wheel on a bike.

meanings.definition: To evade or dodge a task or obligation.
meanings.sent1: He shirks his responsibilities by blaming others.
meanings.sent2: She shirks from helping with the cleanup after dinner.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel shirks gathering nuts by stealing from others.
meanings.sent4: The politician shirks tough questions like a skilled magician.
meanings.sent5: The student shirks studying, hoping luck will be on their side during the test.
